BR_text.BRsummary: SE layers are ignored when constructing se_resnets
BR_text.BRdescription:
gluoncv.model_zoo.get_model('se_resnet50_v1')
 and
 gluoncv.model_zoo.get_model('resnet50_v1')
 returns the same model since the use_se flag is never used. The error is here:
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L555>https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L555</denchmark-link>

comments_1.comment_text:
Interestingly, the code does not work even if I force the use_se flag. In particular I get an error here:
 https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L190
 Check failed: l == 1 || r == 1: operands could not be broadcast together with shapes [2,256,56,56] [2,1024,1,1]

comments_2.comment_text:
I believe here
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L163>https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L163</denchmark-link>
 
 the correct statement is
 self.se.add(nn.Dense(channels, use_bias=False))
 instead of self.se.add(nn.Dense(channels * 4, use_bias=False))

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ifeherva>@ifeherva</denchmark-link>
  Thank you for pointing this out. We will fix it soon.

comments_4.comment_text:
Already fixed the issue in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/pull/1115>#1115</denchmark-link>
  , close the issue for now.
